page.title: 14TRANSPORT, HIGH HAM AND AREA
page.content: 100 households within the area were surveyed with the following results: nearly every household has at least 1 car, with 50% having 2 or more cars. The majority of people surveyed use their car for work and to go shopping. Bus services are limited to one bus a week, on Thursday, which goes to the local town, Langport, waits 2 hours and then returns. Cars are an essential part of village life. Many families also own bicycles for travelling within the local area. 2 of the people surveyed cycle to work and 3 walk. 75% of the children at the Primary School come to school by car. The remaining children cycle or walk to school. The older children are taken to and from Huish Episcopi Comprehensive School by bus. There is 1 garage in High Ham which sells petrol and offers a repair service.
